statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Fletcher Magee drilled a trey to give Wofford a late lead and the Terriers held on to knock Furman from the Southern Conference unbeaten ranks 79-70 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Wofford's late run clinches 79-70 win over Furman
article.linkText: Wofford's late run clinches 79-70 win over Furman
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Fletcher Magee drilled a trey to give Wofford a late lead and the Terriers held on to knock Furman from the Southern Conference unbeaten ranks 79-70 on Saturday night. Furman held a 62-57 advantage with 7:48 remaining when Cameron Jackson slammed home a dunk to start a 14-0 run to take a 71-62 lead as Furman went scoreless for more than four minutes. Devin Sibley drilled a 3-pointer to stop the bleeding at the 3:22 mark. Nathan Hoover answered with a trey and followed with two free throws as Furman failed to score in the final 1:50 and Wofford (12-5, 3-1) took its fourth straight victory. Trevor Stumpe and Cameron Jackson had 20 points apiece for Wofford. Magee finished with 17 and Hoover added 13 points. Sibley had 17 points for Furman (13-5, 4-1) which had not lost since falling to then No. 21 Tennessee 66-61 on December 20.
